title: Set alias for columns in data set but in expression builder still shows the old column names when selecting the dataset
OB: When selecting a dataset in the expression builder and double clicking on the first column name, the expected result is that the alias name should be used instead of the original name, as specified in scr 78193. However, the actual result is that the original name of the column is listed below the expression builder, and the alias name appears above as row['column1'].
EB: To reproduce the bug, follow these steps: 1. Open the expression builder. 2. Select a dataset. 3. Double click on the first column name. The original column name should not appear below the expression builder, and the alias name should appear as row['column1'] after double clicking the original name.
SR: The bug needs to be fixed so that when selecting a dataset in the expression builder, the alias name is used instead of the original name when double clicking on a column name.
